repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: No tests on Linux Arm.

Solution: Add tests on Linux Arm with `RelWithDebInfo`.   Remove duplicate and low-leverage `build-types` job.

comment_data.body: You can remove the `RelWithDebInfo` build in the `build-types` job. In fact, with this I'd say we can remove the `build-types` job entirely as MinSizeRel or Ninja Multi-Config isn't really important enough to warrant a CI job.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -107,6 +107,7 @@ jobs:
             { runner: ubuntu-24.04, os: ubuntu, flavor: asan, cc: clang, flags: -D ENABLE_ASAN_UBSAN=ON },
             { runner: ubuntu-24.04, os: ubuntu, flavor: tsan, cc: clang, flags: -D ENABLE_TSAN=ON },
             { runner: ubuntu-24.04, os: ubuntu, flavor: release, cc: gcc, flags: -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release },
+            { runner: ubuntu-24.04-arm, os: ubuntu, flavor: arm, cc: gcc, flags: -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo },

comment_data.body: @bfredl You'd need to remove the `build-types` job from the list of required checks then.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -107,6 +107,7 @@ jobs:
             { runner: ubuntu-24.04, os: ubuntu, flavor: asan, cc: clang, flags: -D ENABLE_ASAN_UBSAN=ON },
             { runner: ubuntu-24.04, os: ubuntu, flavor: tsan, cc: clang, flags: -D ENABLE_TSAN=ON },
             { runner: ubuntu-24.04, os: ubuntu, flavor: release, cc: gcc, flags: -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release },
+            { runner: ubuntu-24.04-arm, os: ubuntu, flavor: arm, cc: gcc, flags: -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo },

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
Linux (x86_64)     1      >= 2.6.32, glibc >= 2.12     Ubuntu 24.04
Linux (arm64)      1      >= 2.6.32, glibc >= 2.12     Ubuntu 24.04
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -11,15 +11,16 @@ Support                                                              *support*
 ==============================================================================
 Supported platforms					 *supported-platforms*
 
-`System`          `Tier`      `Versions`                  `Tested versions`
-Linux            1      >= 2.6.32, glibc >= 2.12     Ubuntu 24.04
-macOS (Intel)    1      >= 11                        macOS 13
-macOS (M1)       1      >= 11                        macOS 15
-Windows 64-bit   1      >= Windows 10 Version 1809   Windows Server 2022
-FreeBSD          1      >= 10                        FreeBSD 14
-OpenBSD          2      >= 7
-MinGW            2      MinGW-w64
-Windows 64-bit   3      < Windows 10 Version 1809
+`System`            `Tier`      `Versions`                  `Tested versions`
+Linux (x864_64)    1      >= 2.6.32, glibc >= 2.12     Ubuntu 24.04
+Linux (aarch64)    1      >= 2.6.32, glibc >= 2.12     Ubuntu 24.04

comment_data.body: That arch was intentional. Can you tell my _why_ we should use one over the other?

comment_regular_data.body:
Looks good, only issue is permissions with the `vim.ui.open()` tests (which call `xdg-open`) around nonexistent files (I think we had similar on Cirrus):
```
ERROR    test/functional/lua/ui_spec.lua @ 161: vim.ui open() opt.cmd #29490
test/testutil.lua:154: Pattern does not match.
Pattern:
ENOENT: no such file or directory
Actual:
.../_system.lua:0: EACCES: permission denied

stack traceback:
	test/testutil.lua:154: in function 'matches'
	test/functional/lua/ui_spec.lua:162: in function <test/functional/lua/ui_spec.lua:161>
```

Also some compiler warnings.
Let's get the tests in now; release workflow will be a follow-up in the next days.

@dundargoc said so:

Problem: Some CI jobs are redundant: `RelWithDebInfo` is already tested
on Linux-Arm64; `MinSizeRel` and Ninja Multi Config are not sufficiently
relevant in practice to spend CI cycles on.

Solution: Remove `build-types` job.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: automation for build, test, and release
labels.name: ci

title: ci: add arm64 runner
